question: Match the following:
columnB: Day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle when ovulation could be expected
Male partner withdraws his penis before ejaculation to avoid insemination
Effective up to six months following parturition and only during lactation
Chances of fertilisation are very high during this period

answer.Fertile period: Day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle when ovulation could be expected
answer.Withdrawal or coitus interruptus: Male partner withdraws his penis before ejaculation to avoid insemination
answer.Lactational amenorrhea method: Effective up to six months following parturition and only during lactation
answer.Conception prevention during fertile per: Chances of fertilisation are very high during this period

question: Match the following:
columnA: Maximum effective period of lactational amenorrhea
Chances of failure in natural methods
columnB: Up to six months following parturition
None, but chances of failure are high
High chances of failure compared to other methods
Condoms, diaphragms, cervical caps, vaults

answer.Maximum effective period of lactational: Up to six months following parturition
answer.Side effects of natural methods: None, but chances of failure are high
answer.Chances of failure in natural methods: High chances of failure compared to other methods

question: Match the following:
columnB: Disposable sheath to cover penis
Popular contraceptive in India
Worn inside the vagina
Protect the user from sexually transmitted diseases (STDs)

answer.Benefit of condoms: Protect the user from sexually transmitted diseases (STDs)

question: Match the following:
columnB: Cover cervix and prevent entry of sperms
Block meeting of ovum and sperms
Immobilise and kill sperms
Increase contraceptive efficiency

answer.Diaphragms, cervical caps and vaults: Cover cervix and prevent entry of sperms
answer.Function of rubber barriers: Block meeting of ovum and sperms

question: Match the following:
columnA: One child norm mostly adopted by
columnB: Hum Do Hamare Do (We two, our two)
18 years
21 years
Young, urban, working couples

answer.Slogan promoting small family norm: Hum Do Hamare Do (We two, our two)

question: Match the following:
columnA: Method that does not interfere with sexual drive
Contraceptive measures taken to tackle population problem
columnB: User-friendly, easily available, effective, reversible, with least side effects
Mechanical/chemical prevention of sperm reaching ovum
Barrier methods
Advertisements, education and government programmes

answer.Ideal contraceptive should be: User-friendly, easily available, effective, reversible, with least side effects
answer.Barrier methods fall under: Mechanical/chemical prevention of sperm reaching ovum

question: Match the following:
columnB: Avoiding chances of meeting of ovum and sperms
Day 10 to 17 of menstrual cycle
Highly fertile phase of menstrual cycle
Prevent fertilisation without use of devices or chemicals

answer.Natural method working principle: Avoiding chances of meeting of ovum and sperms
answer.Fertile period of menstrual cycle: Highly fertile phase of menstrual cycle
answer.Natural methods aim to: Prevent fertilisation without use of devices or chemicals

question: Match the following:
columnB: Lippes loop
CuT, Cu7, Multiload 375
Progestasert, LNG-20
Trained medical professionals

question: Match the following:
columnA: Hormone releasing IUDs effect on uterus
Hormone releasing IUDs effect on cervix
columnB: Suppress motility and fertilising capacity of sperms
Make uterus unsuitable for implantation
Thicken cervical mucus to prevent sperm entry
Females looking for long-term reversible contraception

answer.Cu ions in IUDs function: Suppress motility and fertilising capacity of sperms
answer.Hormone releasing IUDs effect on cervix: Thicken cervical mucus to prevent sperm entry
answer.IUDs suitable for: Females looking for long-term reversible contraception
